title: Add Indonesian language option to the language menu

requirements.text: Add Indonesian as a supported UI language across the app by (1) adding a new language option with code "id" to the language dropdown, (2) extending the Language type to include "id", and (3) providing a full Indonesian translation entry for all existing translation keys used by the UI.

quotes: can you add a indonesian language in the languag menu

acceptanceCriteria: The language selector dropdown includes an Indonesian option labeled "Bahasa Indonesia" with the Indonesia flag emoji (ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡©) and uses language code "id".

Selecting Indonesian updates all UI labels/buttons/messages that are driven by LanguageContext translations (e.g., titles, form labels/placeholders, View Feedback, PIN dialog strings, table headers, empty/error states).
TypeScript builds without errors and no components reference a missing translation key for the "id" language.
If a user selects Indonesian, the app does not crash and renders translated strings everywhere translations are used.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Fixing the "View Feedback" loading failure (PIN gating, React Query, or backend responsiveness issues) is out of scope for this request unless directly caused by adding the Indonesian language option.
